meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unmoral.
meanings.sent1: The teacher discussed the unmoralities of the character in the story.
meanings.sent2: The community was shocked by the unmoralities of the politician.
meanings.sent3: The play humorously portrayed the unmoralities of the clumsy protagonist.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork symbolically represented the unmoralities of society.
meanings.sent5: The book vividly described the unmoralities of the ancient civilization.

meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors that are not in accordance with moral principles.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper exposed the unmoralities of the corrupt company.
meanings.sent2: The court dealt with the unmoralities of the accused individuals.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie exaggerated the unmoralities of the silly characters.
meanings.sent4: The storm served as a metaphor for the unmoralities of nature.
meanings.sent5: The documentary highlighted the unmoralities of the unethical business practices.
